question: Which of the following works is contained in the Charaka Samhita?
explanation: Charaka Samhita is a work on architecture. The Charaka Saṃhita or Compendium of Charaka is a Sanskrit text on Ayurveda. Along with the Susruta-saṃhita, it is one of the two foundational Hindu texts of this field that have survived from ancient India. The pre-2nd century CE text consists of eight books and one hundred twenty chapters.
